Create ragged array timeseries NCDF file

Source: R/write_timeseries_ragged_dsg.R
write_timeseries_ragged_dsg.Rd

This creates a ragged array timeseries discrete sampling features NCDF file

write_timeseries_ragged_dsg(nc_file, all_data, data_units = list(),
  data_longnames = list(), attributes = list())

Arguments

nc_file

A string file path to the nc file to be created.
all_data

A data.frame object containing all station and observation data. See description for further information
data_units

Optional list of observation units. Names must correspond to names of observation columns in all_data. Not required. Columns without supplied data unit are given a unit of empty string.
data_longnames

Optional named list of observation long names. Names must correspond to names of observation columns in all_data. Not required. Columns without supplied long name are given a long name of empty string.
attributes

An optional list of attributes that will be added at the global level. See details for useful attributes.

Details

It's challenging to create a function that accepts the style of data that could go into the ragged array timeseries DSG. This is one attempt, though ideas and feedback are welcome.

The all_data data.frame is the heart of the data passed. It must have the following columns.

  • station_name

  • lat

  • lon

  • alt

  • time

  • observation1

  • ...

  • observationN

observation1 and observationN are just placeholders. Observations should be described with a descriptive name. There can be any number of observations, but their names must be unique.

Attributes allow for addition, non-core metadata to be included. Must be a named list. All items in the list will be added as global attributes to the NC file with the supplied name/value pair.

Here are some common important attributes that could be added.

  • title = "title"

  • abstract = "history"

  • provider site = "institution"

  • provider name ="source"

  • description = "description"

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Details
